Senior C++ developer; banking, financial, or quantitative experience is a plus

Essential Algorithms Solutions

Job Description

Essential Algorithms Solutions (EAS) has an opening for two (2) experienced senior-level C++ programmers to add to our existing team.  This work-from-home contract style position offers a full time opportunity to each developer selected for the position.

This advertisement is intended for senior-level applicants with demonstrable experience in a professional work environment.  While financial experience is not required, applicants with experience in financial-related software development or in quantitative development will receive priority over developers that do not have this type of previous experience.  Applicants will be expected to have the requisite knowledge and experience needed to create professional-quality, bug-free production quality applications.  The range of projects is split between two separate product lines currently maintained by the company.  The first collection of projects relates to a sports wagering software that produces statistics, betting odds, and supporting structures.  The second and newest collection of projects relates to the banking and finance realms.  Examples include integration with exchanges, development of buy/sell algorithms, and creation of various web services to facilitate online banking.  Many of the projects we take on are of advanced level and require analysis and planning on an individual basis in addition to code writing.

For this position, emphasis is placed on the applicant's ability to produce solutions with minimal outside help.  As this is a senior-level position, all applicants are expected to be able to write the required applications from start to finish, including design of any database queries or tables.  Design specifications will be provided for each project prior to commencement.  While actual programming ability is one of the key requirements of this position, applicants for this senior-level posting are expected to show initiative and take a practical approach towards solving real-world problems.

The projects are challenging and quite exciting, and even the most experienced of candidates are certain to learn new skills and techniques while working with our company.

Skills & Requirements

  1. Advanced C++ background
  2. Past experience working in a senior-level posting
  3. Ability to write fully-debugged, real-world applications from start to finish with minimal supervisory intervention
  4. Knowledge of web services, such as REST, JSON APIs
  5. Working knowledge of how web documents are structured (HTML and XML)
  6. Strong investigative skills, such as ability to "figure out" an acceptable algorithm to buy/sell commodities;
  7. Diverse background in customer-facing as well as B2B software;
  8. Ability to design tables, indexes, and SQL queries to support the data layer of applications.  Specific experience with MySQL preferred.
  9. Optional:  Working knowledge of the Qt5 C++ framework

About Essential Algorithms Solutions

Essential Algorithms Solutions is a multinational software company that produces solutions tailored to various industries.  The company's original focus was the online gaming sector.  The company has since also expanded into financial markets and trading exchanges.  Current products include a WebSockets-powered real time sports betting application with an HTML5 responsive frontend, 3D "true to life" casino games developed on a responsive cross-platform HTML5 framework, and a thorough and innovative CRM (Customer Relationship Management) tool.  EAS uses both on-site and remotely-located developers to form a talented, agile team.

items.title: Full-Time Designer For Our Web Applications (React.js), Marketing Websites and Corporate Identity
items.content:
Hi there.  We're Action Verb and we build Infrastructure-as-a-Service products.  We've been around for almost 10 years, operate profitably, and will probably make the Inc 5000 list this year.

We offer two main products:  BrickFTP,  a hosted file sharing service for business, and Vae Platform, a unique web hosting platform with an integrated CMS system.  Our IaaS services have over 2,000 paying business customers.

We're small, happy, and we avoid the Silicon Valley startup culture that encourages growth over sustainability.  We treat each team member like family.  We have 9 full time staff now (plus 3 part time) and we're looking to grow our family by adding a full time designer to our team.

As a company, we are one of the early adopters of Holacracy, a new style of running an organization in a self-organizing manner that draws inspiration from agile software development and lean manufacturing processes.  

Rather than hiring people for exactly one job description, we instead look to find well rounded team members with skills in design, coding, marketing, sales, and our other needs who are interested in filling multiple roles within the organization.

As a self-organizing team, our people have multiple roles and our role descriptions are regularly updated via small iterations.  The roles you take on are intended to change over time as your interests change and our needs change.

Ã¢Â Â Most startups believe in iteration of their products. Now they need to apply the same thinking to their organizations.Ã¢Â Â  
Ã¢Â Â Adam Pisoni, Yammer co-founder & CTO

At Action Verb, you don't have a boss.  Your work is executed autonomously, without micromanagement.

But Holacracy is not unstructured: you'll have a clear understanding of your current roles and responsibilities, as well as a set of rules and processes for changing those roles and responsibilities in real time.

Our team members work from home and choose their own hours, allowing them to make time for family, recreation, vacations, or anything that is important to them.

Our team members also work hard, are constantly learning, and accomplish a ton for the company in the time that they are working.  That's why we consistently pay above-market rates for talent and are generous with raises and bonuses.  For designers, our typical pay rate is $100,000 per year, plus a very competitive benefits package.

Even though Holacracy is a lot to learn, we have a great onboarding process and the rest of our team will guide you through your first few months.  We will take responsibility for ensuring that you quickly learn how to be productive at Action Verb.  We expect that you'll be more productive here than you've been anywhere else.

We believe that building great products requires great infrastructure.  We have Continuous Integration, a full staging environment, and great READMEs across our system.  We built our own application deployment system.  We self-manage our server stack on Amazon EC2 and custom hardware.

We believe in using the right tool for the job.  Our application frontends are built in React.js and Ruby on Rails.  Our eventual goal is to move everything to React.js on the frontend for our large applications, so we are really looking for folks with React experience.

However, as new frameworks come out, we are looking for someone who will stay on top of the latest trends in Javascript development and push us in the right direction.

We believe that the best designers know how to code.  WeÃ¢Â Â re looking for someone who can bring the following things to the table:

  • Experience with web application design, marketing website design, and offline (print) design
  • Comprehensive understanding of UI/UX principles
  • Solid web front-end development skills in HTML, CSS, and Javascript.  Even though we have a great team to help you integrate your designs with our applications, in order to be a great application designer, we expect that you can implement enough Javascript to make your designs come to life (even in a basic way).
  • Ability to prioritize and make decisions without needing to be micromanaged
  • History designing actual SaaS or desktop applications that have seen production usage with real customers.
  • Truly interested in giving our customers a great experience and able to communicate directly with customers and prospects

We believe that open-source only works if companies give back.  If you work on any open-source projects during the course of your work at Action Verb, you are encouraged to submit your improvements as a pull request back to the upstream project.  And if you build something from scratch while working here thatÃ¢Â Â s generic and not related to our core products, we want you to release that on GitHub too.  WeÃ¢Â Â ll also pay your travel costs to any conference where you can get a speaking gig.

We believe that our products will never be finished.  We are committed to continuously improving our customer experience.  We constantly reach out to our customers to learn about new ways that we can help them get their job done.

Tell us about what you believe.  Please use the form on this page to send in your application now.  We only read cover letters in our first screening round, so make sure yours counts.  Specifically, we'd like you to address the following topics:

  • What is your level of experience with Holacracy?  Had you heard about it prior to this posting?  Do you have any questions about it?
  • What is your level of experience with a remote team?
  • What would be your ideal focus areas and roles within the company?  (Please understand that our current needs are mostly on the design side, but we always prefer folks with broad areas of interest.)

Important Notes:

  • Since this is a design-focused posting, please also provide portfolio links to things you designed.  Ideally this portfolio will include web applications, marketing websites, and physical print design.
  • Compensation requirements for designers also tend to be all over the map.  Please include your requested salary in the application so we can better understand your application from the start.
  • USA-based applicants are strongly preferred.
  • We hope to hear from you (and SEE what you've done)!

* Be an expert in designing PowerPoint presentations that are succinct and powerful, with a balance of high-level insights for senior management and detailed explanations for the core teams.
* Be comfortable not only thinking and working independently but also collaboratively within teams to develop creative and quick results.
* Evangelise, educate and support business users in their quest to answer data questions.
* Champion use of data for driving decisions & development.

* Our Ideal MVFer*

* The detective skills to solve data riddles, and the people skills to get you there.
* Deep curiosity for under covering new insights and solving problems.
* A love of solving data problems and learning new things.
* Strong commercial understanding and business acumen - the analysis and insight you provide will have real business impacts.
* Grit and persistence: “Data do not give up their secrets easily. They must be tortured to confess.”
* Work smart, move fast and learn quickly.
* Passion for creating highly usable and thorough dashboards/visualisations to be consumed by management and stakeholders.
* We live and breath SQL every day. You should know core SQL back to front and have an interest in mastering the fancy stuff.
* Excel is your playground, VLOOKUPS and pivot tables are second nature.

If you have a true passion for data and are driven to learn, develop and become world class through innovative, data savvy decisions, then please apply.

We can’t wait to meet you.

We are a young, fast growing start-up in the interiors world, and are looking for someone who can really hit the ground running and share our passion for interiors and design! This role is ideal for someone who really wants to make their mark in a company.

Key Responsibilities:

Digital Marketing & E-Commerce - Management of Acquisition, Conversion and Retention Channels
Content Marketing - Overseeing all copywriting, development of content strategy and content calendar
Reporting and analysis – Monitoring key KPI’s and reporting on them on a regular basis.

Role Breakdown:

Creating, implementing and managing the entire ecommerce online strategy, and day to day website management
Digital Marketing Acquisition– Implementation of SEO best practice for Organic traffic, Paid Advertising (Google Adwords, Google Shopping, Pinterest, Facebook, Instagram, Houzz), Affiliate marketing and Retargeting ensuring a high ROI
Ecommerce for UK with ROW in roadmap
Email Marketing & Customer Retention – Generate the email marketing strategy and calendar.
Create/maintain campaigns for the various customer segments we have, including loyalty, retention, reactivation using a marketing automation tool.

Social Media- Create and implement a social media strategy whilst working with the content writer to ensure that the content for all our channels is consistent with digital objectives.
Content management – ensure that the content is always up-to-date and brand consistent.
Setting up campaigns and promotions on the website.
Visual Merchandising
Constantly looking for ways to improve the user experience and the conversion rate of the website.
Working on ad-hoc e-commerce & digital projects
Legal and Regulatory management
Work closely with other teams to ensure that the brand voice is consistent across all channels

Personal Qualities
A web specialist who has experience across the digital landscape, not just in marketing but in design, UX and wider ecommerce disciplines including promotions.
Strong communicator and naturally high achiever
Commercially aware with a desire and drive to grow sales and brand awareness
Metric and measurement focused who can help to develop processes to measure the web’s success and gain buy in and excitement for this throughout the business
Analytically minded with a good understanding of Google Analytics and its implementation
Experience with Magento and Wordpress, desirable but not essential.
Technically proficient in Excel, Google Docs, Gmail, PowerPoint, etc.
Experience in working in a small business, ability to multitask is essential.
Driven and self-motivating – we need you to be confident in your convictions and be prepared to present your proposals to stakeholders and be a leader
Ability to think strategically but with a hands on approach to delivering outcomes and a can-do attitude operationally
A real love and passion for interiors and design!

items.title: Senior Product Manager
items.content:
DESCRIPTION

Festicket is transforming the way music fans discover and book tickets and travel packages for festivals around the world. Our platform revolutionises the music festival industry by offering an end-to-end experience for music travellers through an efficient two-sided marketplace for 900+ music festivals across 50 different countries! In three short years, we have become Europe's largest music festival platform.

This year we've announced a Series B raise - https://techcrunch.com/2016/06/30/festicket-let-it...

YOUR ROLE

We are looking for an experienced Technical Product Manager who is passionate about building products that customers love. You will join a dynamic and fast-paced environment and work with cross-functional teams to design, build and roll-out products that deliver the company’s vision and strategy.

We've had a big funding round earlier this year and our technical team whom you'll be working very closely with is growing rapidly (from 4 to 14 people so far). You will work within the product team who manage the product design and data currently, whilst looking after the core technical product and new features very closely with the technical team.

Furthermore, we aim to grow a dedicated Product team around yourself in the coming months.

THE STACK

http://stackshare.io/festicket/festicket

METHODOLOGY

We work incrementally but do occasionally take on bigger projects to update our stack and offering. Our current methodology is agile kanban.

RESPONSIBLITIES

Work closely with engineering teams to deliver with quick time-to-market and optimal resources
Gain a deep understanding of customer experience, identify and fill product gaps and generate new ideas that grow market share, improve customer experience and drive growth
Create buy-in for the product vision both internally and with key external partners
Translate product strategy into detailed requirements and prototypes
Drive product launches including working with public relations team, executives, and other product management team members
Represent the company by visiting customers to solicit feedback on company products and services
REQUIREMENTS

YOUR ATTITUDE

You’re someone who’s smart, organised, motivated and gets things done. You want to work in a startup environment, because you like the idea of doing a bit of everything and taking ownership of what you work on. You have ideas about everything, and you’re not afraid to argue your point (while respecting everyone else’s of course). You’re constantly thinking “how can we do this better?”.

You understand the hard work required to update and stabilise a large technical product and you are prepared to put this work into the project.

YOUR SKILL SET

* Proven 3+ years work experience in product management
* Proven track record of managing all aspects of a successful product throughout its lifecycle
* Solid technical background with understanding and/or hands-on experience in software development and web technologies
* Strong problem solving skills and willingness to roll up one’s sleeves to get the job
* MSc/BSc degree in Computer Science, Engineering or equivalent background preferred.
* Experience in a medium / large startup (Series A or B of funding or equivalent)
* E-commerce background desirable (to understand the notion of conversion rate, retention etc...)

BENEFITS

We’re a team of 65 located in an amazing converted piano factory in Camden (NW1 8LH) a short stroll from Camden market and Primrose Hill. By joining us you will be part of one of the fastest growing music / travel start-up companies in Europe, where you will have ample opportunity for career progression as we continue to grow.

We have a company culture which is very idea orientated and driven but also very social. It's entirely normal at 6pm on a Friday for half the company to be drinking together in the office and then planning to head out for a night out.

items.title: Digital Marketing Manager
items.content:

* Managing Prelinks' Facebook Ads campaigns - for both acquisition of new users and engagement of existing ones
* Producing highly engaging content, that can support and drive the paid acquisition strategy

* Working with the development and product team - using data and insight gained in marketing - to develop the app and platform

items.title: Marketing Analyst

items.title: Marketing Manager
items.content:

Sell Sprint is the most convenient way for busy people to sell their unwanted luxury fashion goods.

Our premium offering is tailored to suit those who are time-poor, and our clients expect only the best user experience around.

You can expect to work directly with luxury brands, high net worth individuals and high-end retailers.

Why join us?

1) This is an excellent opportunity to work in a hands-on role with a funded start-up which is rapidly growing. You can expect quick career progression as we scale if you’re able to deliver results.
2) We have an award-winning founder and team, and our investors have built some of the biggest brands on the planet.

We’re looking for someone to head-up our marketing. You’ll be key to our growth efforts.

Your primary focus will be growing our user base of sellers using a plethora of digital channels. You will be a highly analytical self-starter; able to quickly test and iterate based on resulting data across all relevant performance channels. You will have an entrepreneurial approach, and be keen to develop further skills and frameworks required to solve complex analytical challenges.

This is a brilliant opportunity to immerse yourself in the world of luxury, and to lead a growing brand with international ambitions on the front-line. You will be solving a genuine problem for people who lack time, in a way that no business has been able to before.

What responsibilities can you expect?

• Leading our acquisition efforts across all performance channels.
• Evaluating and heading-up our wider growth strategy.
• Managing and contributing to our content strategy as part of our product offering.
• Creating and managing campaigns; both acquisition and retention.
• Reporting strategy, data and results to the CEO and advisors.

What skills and qualities do we require?

• 2 years relevant work experience in a marketing role, having ideally had some experience in the luxury and/or fashion spaces.
• Experience with paid search, social media and retargeting. We’re keen to see evidence of past successes.
• Experience with CRO, LTV Optimisation, campaign planning and execution.
• Ability to manage street-level campaigns and cross-promotional strategy.
• Capable of effectively managing others in-house and externally where necessary.
• Autonomous in approach, proactive, hard-working and results-driven.
• Strong communication skills and able to effectively convey our brand image. A high standard of written and spoken English is essential.
• Experience in pitching ideas both internally and externally, project planning and execution.
• Highly organised, high-energy and enthusiastic.

What skills are not essential, but desirable?

• Able to use Microsoft Word, Excel and PowerPoint to a good standard.
• The ability to create high-quality, premium content on the luxury and fashion spaces, or at least vet and manage others who can.

What can you expect?

• A competitive salary.
• Shares in the business.
• A very sociable and interactive office environment.
• Regular team activities and away-days.
• Highly qualified and ambitious teammates.

How can I apply?

Please send us your CV along with a covering email explaining why you’d like to come and work with us!

items.title: Performance Marketing Manager
items.content:

At Fnatic we believe great marketing is authentic, adds value, is playful and is the pillar on which to grow our brand towards our mission. Our goal is to be the number one lifestyle brand from esports within 3 years, and we’ve got a lot of work to do.

Experience in a performance marketing role for consumer and lifestyle focussed brands, matched with an insatiable curiosity of what's to come.
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills, drawing from an ability to draw insights from large data sets.

Fluency in English, both written and verbal.

Based in London you’ll have a permit / visa or similar to work in the UK as required.

The opportunity to work for the largest and most recognisable brand in one of the most exciting and fastest growing industries.
Working with an ambitious and super creative team, learning everything about the ins and outs of running a fast paced business.
A very competitive base salary with the potential for options.
Great office in the heart of Shoreditch in London, with 8 other locations around the world.
Potential for travel for the business around the world.
Varied workload, never complacent.
Friends and Family discounts on our products.

items.title: Content Manager
items.content:
What we Do

At The Mimic method, we create products for people to learn languages online. 
But our approach is different from that of other language companies. We don’t 
teach literacy, grammar theory, or translation like everyone else.

Instead, we help people unblock their hearing and pronunciation in the 
language.

 * When you unblock your hearing, you can understand native speakers when they 
talk fast.
 * When you unblock your pronunciation, you can impress native speakers with 
your accent.
The more you can understand and impress people in conversation, the more you 
can connect with them. We don’t care about people reading foreign language 
newspapers or passing language certification exams.

We care about people making human connections across the language barrier.

We believe the world would be a better place if more people did this. There 
would be less fear and violence and more love and creativity. If you agree with 
our philosophy, and you want to help us in our mission, then we may have the 
perfect job for you…

The Position – Content Manager

To promote our brand, we need to produce content that is educational, 
entertaining and original. The more articles, videos and graphics we produce, 
the more visitors we bring to the site.

As Content Manager, you will start by creating most of the content yourself.

This is the fastest way to familiarize yourself with our learning philosophy 
and voice. After initial onboarding, expect to produce articles each week to 
start. You will also test different marketing strategies while communicating 
directly with our audience through email and social media.

Speaking directly with readers and customers is the fastest way to develop 
your marketing intuition.

Then soon as you have a good feel for what works, you will help build our 
“content machine.”

This involves formalizing the processes for content research, production and 
publication. It also involves recruiting, training and managing other people to 
operate the machine.

In the long run, you will focus less on content creation and more on strategy 
and leadership.

Scope of Work (a day in the life)

 * Full Time position
 * “High-Touch,” calls multiple times per week
 * Manage blog content and guest post outreach
 * Produce/Edit 2-3 blog content per week
 * Doing research within the audience and tailoring content according to their 
needs
 * Coordinate with writers, designers and other freelancers
 * Keeping up with the SEO industry at least on the surface
Compensation and Career

We are looking for an Intrapreneurial-type person to grow with our company in 
the long term.

Currently, we work as a distributed team. That means you can work from 
anywhere in the world on your own schedule. All that we require is that you are 
very reachable and deliver results.

During this 6-month trial period, we will pay you $2,000 per month. If the 
trial goes well, we will negotiate a higher full-time salary based on your 
performance.

In the long term, your salary will increase as the company expands. And if you 
prove yourself to be a rockstar, there is a potential for commissions and/or 
profit share.

Learning and Growth

Learning and Growth are two of our core values at The Mimic Method. One way 
that we live these values is by investing heavily in our own continued 
education.

If we select you for this position, we will provide you with anything you need 
to make you a more effective Content Manager. This means professional training 
in highly useful skills like digital marketing, copywriting, and 
personnel management, etc.

There is no better way for you to develop than to study the most effective 
strategies out there and apply them to a real world setting.

We are looking for someone who values growth and learning above all else – and 
we plan to nurture this value.

Must-have Qualities

For this position, we are looking for someone with a specific set of 
qualities. Since we know these qualities to be rare, most people reading this 
will NOT have them all.

Please do not apply for this job unless you have ALL the qualities described 
below.

 * Values-Aligned
 * Shrewd/Intellectual
 * Well-spoken/well-written
 * Highly-structured
 * Results-Driven
Allow me to briefly touch upon each trait.

Values-Aligned

To work with us long term, you need to share our core values of Truth, Growth, 
Education and Respect.

If you strongly identify with the statements below, then you probably share 
our values:

 * I must constantly grow as a person, otherwise I am dying.
 * I have an insatiable appetite for knowledge, and I will continue learning 
for the rest of my life.
 * My sex, gender, race, ethnicity, sexual orientation, nationality, etc, 
doesn’t make me inherently superior to anyone, which is why I make a point to 
respect everyone.
 * Before I die, I must travel the world and know its people as much as I can.
 * Before I die, I must create or contribute to something meaningful.
Do you share these values? If so, keep reading!

Introspective/Shrewd

Are you the introspective type? Do you spend way too much time contemplating 
the nature of society, the cosmos, or the inner-workings of your own mind?

I know I do.

As content manager, you and I will speak on a regular basis to develop content 
and strategy together.

If you are a fellow introspective, then our conversations will energize us 
both. This energy will transfer to our work and enable us to reach our goals 
faster.

But I don’t want someone who thinks like me. I’m a bit of a scatter-brain, so 
I need an unscattered brain to complement my thinking.  

 * Have you always had an intuitive understanding of people’s thoughts and 
emotions?
 * Do you often know what people are going to say before they say it?
 * Has someone ever told you “I feel like you know me better than I know 
myself!”
If so, then you might be exactly the person I’m looking for.

Well Spoken/Well Written

My preferred style of communication is live conversation. To refine my ideas, 
I need to stress-test them in debate. Are you able to formulate your views in 
the moment and present them with clear argumentation? If so, then I’m looking 
forward to our first conversation!

But more important than that, I need someone with superb writing skills.

You need to take complex subjects and break them down into simple 
explanations. Your writing must be clear but also enjoyable to read. Bonus 
points if you can spice it up with some humor!

Your writing ability will be the main thing that we’ll test you on during the 
interview process.

Highly Structured

Most people love the idea of working on their own schedule, but few people are 
actually cut out for it.

Getting things done on a consistent basis without a rigid external structure 
requires discipline.

For this role, we need someone who’s always had that sort of discipline. The 
type of person who likes to organize work schedules, computer files and sock 
drawers for the fun of it.

If you’re the right person, then you know exactly what I’m talking about!

Results Driven

As fun and interesting as all this language stuff may be, at the end of the 
day, we want results.

As content manager, your chief aim is to drive traffic to our site.

We we will assess your performance based on hard metrics like views and 
shares. So those of you who are numerophobic need not apply.

We are looking for someone with grit; someone who won’t stop working at 
something until she gets the results she’s looking for.

Nice-to-Have Qualities

The following qualities are not required for the application, but they are 
helpful. If you have any of them, be sure to mention in your application video:

 * Can speak multiple languages
 * Has learned 1 or more foreign language to fluency as an adult
 * Is willing to spend extensive time in Lisbon, Portugal (company HQ)
 * Can play a musical instrument or can sing
 * Has extensive experience writing for other publications.
 * Has maintained a personal blog or vlog for extended period of time.
 * Knows how to write SEO-friendly articles
 * Has experience in online marketing (Content, Social Media, PPC, etc.)
 * Has experience managing personel.
 * Has experience in online business.
Application Process

Apply Here! <https://mimicmethod.typeform.com/to/vbjflO>

There will be 3 steps to this selection process:

 * Writing test and video application
 * Interview round 1 and Video Test
 * Interview round 2
Writing Test and Video Application

The first step is to test your ability to translate my random thoughts into 
clear prose.

In the video below, I explain the importance of memorizing scripts for 
language-learning. At the moment of recording, I improvised a metaphor about 
swimming that turned out much less clear than I hoped.

Writing Test (Start video at 4:30)

https://youtu.be/5WOO-P6evis <https://youtu.be/5WOO-P6evis>

Your job is to figure out what my point was (if I ever had one) and write it 
out clearly and convincingly in a blog post. You may use as few or as many 
words as you deem necessary.

The main goal is to have a quality piece of content that captures the essence 
of what I was trying to communicate.

Video Application

Next, you must record a video of yourself explaining two things:

 * Why do you want this position?
 * Why should we want you?
The video should be between 3-10 minutes in length and uploaded to a 
video-hosting service like vimeo or youtube.

Once your video and article are ready, fill out this application form 
<https://mimicmethod.typeform.com/to/vbjflO>. In the form, you will be able to 
attach your test article as a PDF and application video as a URL link.

Interview Round 1 & Test

If I like your video and writing sample, I will contact you to set up a skype 
interview.

At the end of this interview, I will explain a phonetic concept to you. Then 
it will be your job to create a short video explanation of that concept.

The goal here is to test your versatility as an educator and content creator.

Interview Round 2

If you make it past the video test, we will have a final interview with you 
and the rest of the team. This is where we ask the tough questions to weed out 
the final winner.

—

Does this description fit you? Are you game for some unconventional 
interviewing practices?

Do you want to start a new location-independent career, build something epic, 
grow professionally, and potentially get rich in the process?

Then send us an application ASAP! <https://mimicmethod.typeform.com/to/vbjflO>

* projecting & sharing monthly product and growth updates

Touchnote is growing rapidly and is looking for a Business Analyst (BA) who will be able to utilise and develop cutting-edge technology to work on a variety of projects and process enhancements alongside the different teams and functions within the company, in order to drive efficiencies, maximize CPA and improve ROI throughout the business.

About the Role*

You’ll work with Financial Systems and Technology partners to ensure that all Revenues, COGS, Opex etc. are correctly assigned, grouped and recorded within the business, driving the budget and forecasting process for the business from cost attribution and a product analysis point of view.
Modelling for spend and revenue through key segments that can be used to drive the business forward, though LTV optimization and product margin analysis, you’ll enhance the processes wherever possible and reduce manual intervention and manipulation throughout.

This role will report to the Finance Director and will be responsible for pursuing issues that exist and pushing through to resolution by working with the other teams (specifically Marketing and Technology). Owning the analysis on key metrics and core KPI’s for the business and the underlying assumptions, you’ll seek to understand, document and improve the current business cycles and processes, devising reporting format for key departments and Stakeholders.

*About You

Essential*

*Qualification in Accounting (Part or Fully qualified) would be advantageous
*Demonstrated excellence in Excel and the skills to build detailed models; proficiency in PowerPoint and Word
*Ability to quickly assimilate computer programs into skill base
*Knowledge of banking and treasury functionality (electronic payments, credit card systems, mobile wallets)
*Strong analytical and systems thinking skills
*Excellent time management and detail organisation skills
*Strong interpersonal skills to develop positive, effective relationships with other departments/business partners
*Strong verbal, written, and listening skills
*Ability to effectively interface with all levels of staff and management

*Desirable*

*BA/BSc in Banking, Mathematics, Accounting, Economics, Finance, Systems, IT, Database Management, Computer Science
*Knowledge of MySQL and navigating that database software
*Comfortable with ambiguity, and delivering under pressure in complex, fast-paced environments.


*About Touchnote*

Touchnote is the world’s most popular postcard-sending service. We were ranked UK's 9th fastest growing technology company, in Deloitte's Fast50 2015 ranking.

Our mission is to become the most meaningful way for family and close friends to stay in touch.

We started in 2008 in London and have since sent millions of personalised cards worldwide. Our apps and website have been featured in the world's leading press, in Google Play and iTunes, and on grandparents’ fridges worldwide.

Our app is available on the iPhone, iPad, Android mobiles and tablets as well as on our website.

*Salary and Benefits*

£45,000 OTE (pro rata for part-time)

All employees are also entitled to:

*20 days holiday plus the week between Christmas and New Years to work from home, 1 week remote working and your Birthday off
*Fortnightly work from home day
*Company laptop (Mac or PC - you choose!)
*Choice of wellbeing benefits which include Private Medical Insurance and/or a gym membership
*A membership with Perkbox which gives employees access to plentiful discounts such as half price cinema tickets at major cinemas including Odeon and Vue, a free Tastecard and many more
*Free breakfast and snacks
*Friday drinks
*Team lunch fortnightly
*Team socials every month
*Free Touchnote credits to use our product

items.title: Digital Marketing Executive
items.content:
ABOUT URBAN MASSAGE

We're very proud to be a fast growing start-up making our mark on the well-being industry. Our world-class platform enables brilliantly talented therapists to provide caring treatments to customers wherever and whenever they want a well deserved treat. In the past 2 years we've launched in 3 international locations and provided hundreds of thousands of massages to customers in need of a treat! We're now looking at many other international locations this year and a range of different wellness services.
As a team, we're just under 50 global employees. We do all we can to make our work environment one we love, can be ourselves in, and can be really successful in. This means lots of working and playing hard (at our Friday drinks and socials) and a chilled office full of ping-pong tables, free yoga classes and pets. Our roles come with a lot of responsibility and empowerment - we like to employ brilliant people and give them the freedom to achieve brilliant things. You can find more passionate detail about working here on Glassdoor - or just ask us!

THE ROLE

We're presently expanding to new German speaking markets - Austria initially and thereafter - who knows! This growth has prompted a requirement for someone to lead us in growing and optimising our performance marketing initiatives for these locations as well as providing ongoing support for our biggest market - the UK.
Performance marketing is one of our most important acquisition channels and has a huge impact on our success - we've seen with previous launches that when these channels perform well, around 50% of new customers find us through them.
Performance marketing at Urban Massage involves SEM (Search Engine Marketing) and paid social (PPC / paid impression). You would have ownership of both - from set-up through to management and optimisation.
You'll be part of a collabroative, growing marketing function based in London which serves as our centre of excellence for our growing global business. As well as applying your expertise and performing this role - you'd have a say in the strategic direction of marketing here have great exposure to other areas. We have lots of passionate experts working in this space who are excited about this new role!
On a day to day basis, you'll work closely with another Digital Marketing Executive who is also focused on the UK and covers French speaking markets too. You'll report to our Global Head of Marketing.
In the long term - we'd like the person that joins us to keep taking on new locations in a bigger role. We're looking at new launches all the time so there's a lot of opportunity here and scope to make an impact.

RESPONSIBILITIES

Ownership of PPC campaigns across different advertising platforms (Google, Facebook, Instagram, Twitter and Criteo)
Keyword research and ad group planning
Creating compelling copy for ads, ensuring the design is aligned with our brand identity
Ensure the appropriate tracking is in place for all activities
Ensure all weekly, monthly & ad hoc performance marketing reports are produced in a timely and accurate manner
Provide actionable next steps for improvement based on current performance
Test new ad creatives and landing pages via A/B testing
Address and escalate campaign performance issues
Stay up to date with latest technologies & best practices

REQUIREMENTS

A Bachelor's degree (or equivalent) from a great university
Fluent German Speaker preferably
Experience in a similar position
Good knowledge of PPC activities - ad-serving, reporting and conversion optimization is a plus
Strong numerical and analytical skills (experience in Excel is vital)
Good level of comfort working with data and KPIs
Ability to research, analyse and present data effectively
Good organisation and time management skills
Excellent attention to detail
Team player with a positive attitude and a sense of humour

BENEFITS

Competitive salary
Join a fast-growing and exciting start-up with excellent growth opportunities
Working with a fun, international and highly-motivated team where there's never a dull moment!
Well-speced Apple hardware
A generous conference and training budget
Free weekly yoga sessions
Discounts on at-home massages
Fully stocked fridges
Central London office with great transport links

THE ROLE:

We're looking for a passionate and experienced Sales Engineer to help us deliver trust at scale to fast-growing international fintech and sharing economy clients.

As Onfido’s Sales Engineer, you will have the opportunity to work with a range of high profile tech companies to support them integrate with our ID verification and Background checking solution effectively, working on complex yet exciting integrations for both potential customers and partners.

You will act as our technical advisor, demonstrating how our can solve specific customer problems, and generate referenceable accounts and a positive brand awareness.

While caring deeply about meeting revenue targets, you’ll also focus on customer success and satisfaction by attending customer meetings, and sharing your learnings about how they work with the Sales Team.

The role will involve:

Proactively engaging with customers to understand their needs
Acting as the key contact for the personal development and technical training of the Sales Team, and organize regular reviews of their technical expertise
Provide technical sales presentations and demos to prospective clients
Collaborate with our engineering and product teams to enhance our product in response to customer feedback and specific client feature requests
Respond to RFPs/RFIs with exceptional clarity and detail
Develop clear and comprehensive solution documentation to pass onto our Engineering teams
Project managing the technical integration and customer onboarding journey during the prospecting stage

REQUIREMENTS

Strong background in and passion for technology, either as a software engineer or pre-sales engineer.
A proactive team player, comfortable presenting in person as you are via conference call and web demo platforms.
Clear understanding of RESTful API design and integration patterns
Prior experience in a communication-focussed role e.g. sales, support, or product
Nice to Have’s

Practical experience with at least one programming language: ideally Python, Ruby, or Javascript
Knowledge of the background checking industry, or our target markets (shared economy, recruitment, fintech) would be desirable
Understanding of security principles and data protection regulation

To be a great fit with the Onfido team, and to really enjoy working with us, you'll be:

A person passionate about their work and also their wide ranging personal interests, we like people who are interesting and interested!
An innovative thinker - the kind of person who is always experimenting with new tools/ systems/ approaches to do things better and faster
A caring and sensitive team member - generous with your own time and highly considerate of your colleagues'
Able to manage time and prioritise tasks effectively, ability to multi-task is a must
Able to think critically, draw upon previous experience to make decisions independently, and exercise good judgment

BENEFITS

We're committed to making Onfido a fantastic place to work, so we go to great lengths to give you what you need to succeed. You will receive:

Unlimited budget for any software or books you need

A fully stocked kitchen with unlimited breakfast, drinks, snacks and fresh fruit every day
Clubs: Coding, Running, Theatre, Games, Poker, Movies and many more!
Cycle to work scheme

Quarterly socials (e.g. cookery classes, go-karting and private cinema trips)
